Text: Alright, your turn, Vito.
[Vito enters a large room with a long dining table with mafia bosses sitting at it.]

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: Gentlemen, this is Vito Scaletta. Vito, know that this family of ours is a secret. You are entering the society of the chosen. A society which does not exist to the rest of the world. Our family means more to you from now on then your own family, or God, or your country. If I ask you to kill your own brother, you must do it. Show me, which finger would pull the trigger?
[Eddie pierces Vito’s finger with a dagger and some drops of blood fall on the picture of the Virgin Mary with the baby Jesus. Eddie sets the picture on fire.]

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: Repeat after me, Vito: If I were to betray the secret of our way of life…

Speaker: Vito
Text: If I were to betray the secret of our way of life…

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: …May my soul burn in hell, just like this saint.

Speaker: Vito
Text: …May my soul burn in hell, just like this saint.

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: Amico nostra.  Gentlemen, I give you our new friend, Vito Scaletta.
[He kisses Vito in the cheek.]

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: I am very pleased to have these two talented and honest men join us. And I’m happy this has happened in the presence of our esteemed guests, especially Don Frank Vinci.

Speaker: Vito
Text: You might wonder why I’d take this risk again after spending almost seven years in the can. You see, where I grew up, the only guys who mattered were the guys who had the balls to take what they wanted.

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: You’ll receive payments for your services from Eddie Would you like to add anything, Frank?

Speaker: Don Frank Vinci
Text: Whatever you do gentleman, stay away from the dope! No dope! That’s our policy. You can make plenty of money, but it’s a filthy business.

Speaker: Vito
Text: And after years of doing everybody else’s dirty work, I was willing to risk anything to finally be somebody.
[We’re seeing Vito’s gangster’s life in motion. He breaks heads, buys expensive cars, cheats with papers, buys a house and kills people with his best friend. He lives a happy and busy life.]
[Vito wakes up from a phone call.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ugh… Hello?

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hey, Vito, it’s Eddie.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hi, Eddie, what’s up?

Speaker: Eddie
Text: I need you to come over to Joe’s, right now.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah… OK, alright… What’s happening?

Speaker: Eddie
Text: I-I-I can’t tell you over the phone.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, I’ll be right there.
[He foes to Joe’s. He sees Marty and some gangster at his apartment door.]

Speaker: Marty
Text: I went at ‘em with a baseball bat and they looked like they was scored ‘til yesterday.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Morning, fellas.

Speaker: Marty
Text: Oh, hey, good mornin’, Vito!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Marty? What are you doing here?

Speaker: Marty
Text: Joe said you needed help, and since I did good with the greasers, he said he’d take me along again.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Take you along again, for what exactly?
[He’s knocking on the apartment door.]

Speaker: Man behind door
Text: They’re waiting for ya…
[Vito goes inside. The door behind him closes quickly.]

Speaker: Marty
Text: Yeah, well ah, I - I’ll talk to you later… heh. Yeah, that’s my man Vito.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Morning, Mr. Falcone.

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: Hiya, Vito. Take a seat.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, guys. Ugh… So what’s happening?

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: I heard how you got rid of Luca, Vito. Good job. Thanks to you we have proof that Clemente was behind the attack on our guys. We couldn’t do anything to him openly ’til now. He just cut his own throat, he kidnapped and tortured our guys and that means war. Anything we do now, I’m gonna be able to justify before The Commission, Alberto knows this, so he’s gonna act quickly and try and come after us first.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So we’re gonna take out Clemente…

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Exactly. Turns out Clemente called a big meeting in the Empire Arms Hotel today. This is our best chance to get rid of him and his top guys.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Oh, sure, yeah. We’ll just waltz right in there and kill a few dozen heavily armed men, in brood daylight, in the nicest hotel in town. Is that about right?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t worry. I got a plan.
[He pulls out a bunch of dynamite.]

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Shit! Joe. Put that thing away!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Eddie, don’t worry, it’s safe. I just gotta press this…

Speaker: Eddie
Text: For Chrissakes, put it away now! What’s the matter with you?

Speaker: Joe
Text: OK, OK. You’re such a chickenshit.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK, OK, so now we’re gonna waltz right in and blow up the nicest hotel in town. Isn’t that overkill?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t worry. This thing ain’t that powerful. It won’t blow up the whole building, but everybody in the room where it goes off… is deed meat.

Speaker: Vito
Text: How are we gonna know when to detonate it?

Speaker: Joe
Text: We’ll use a window washing platform. We’ll almost be able to watch it explode.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Since when are you the smart one?

Speaker: Carlo Falcone
Text: OK, fellas, I’m counting on you. If all goes well, I’ll have something me for you. When it’s over, call Eddie of this number. Oh, by the way, I closed the bar today, just in case Alberto tried something.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hey good luck, fellas.
[Carlo Falcone and Eddie leave the apartment.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, what about that kid in the hallway?

Speaker: Joe
Text: You mean Marty? Uh, he ain’t part of the organization so he had to wait outside.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I mean… why is he here at all?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Why do you think? He’s going with us because we need a getaway driver and somebody to cover our asses. What do you got against him anyway? I known him since he was a little kid and he saved my ass with the greasers.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, but we’re not fighting a bunch of drunk dirtbags this time! We’re about to take out the most powerful family in this city, and you’re bringing a kid!

Speaker: Joe
Text: And how old were you when you started doing this shit? You’re talking like you’re some old fart. Look, Vito, he’s gonna wait in the car outside and drive us away. That’s it. He ain’t even gonna know what we’re doing there. He’s a great driver and that’s exactly what we need on this one.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK, Joe, whatever. But I’m telling you right now. This is a bad idea.
[They leave the apartment.]

Speaker: Marty
Text: Hey, hey, Joe? So, uh, what kind of job is it?

Speaker: Joe
Text: The kind you don’t need to know about, capiche?

Speaker: Marty
Text: Uh, OK, but hey if you need it, I got my piece, right here.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah, alright… Slow down, Billy the Kid alright? It’s not gonna be necessary. Let’s just go. We’ll take my car.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright. I’ll drive.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Just don’t go busting it up on the way there. This is our getaway car. Plus, I’m pretty sure that explosives and car crashes don’t go together too good.

Speaker: Marty
Text: Explosives!? Hahaha…

Speaker: Joe
Text: We’re going to the Empire Arms Hotel. Park in the underground parking lot, and use the back entrance.

Speaker: Marty
Text: So, uh, fellas, c’mon, tell me! What’s going on at the hotel, huh?! C’mon…

Speaker: Joe
Text: What, are you writing a book? I already told you everything you need to know!

Speaker: Marty
Text: Hey, I’m… You know, I’m just curious, you know? All this secrecy…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Marty, all this secrecy’s important. The less you know, the better off you are.

Speaker: Joe
Text: And if you keep asking questions, I’ll just gonna have to find somebody else to drive us next time.

Speaker: Marty
Text: OK OK! No more questions. Sure, sure, whatever… So you’re going to blow the hotel sky high, huh?!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Marty!

Speaker: Marty
Text: Sorry, sorry.

Speaker: Joe
Text: One more word out of you…

Speaker: Marty
Text: Alright, sorry! Not another word… Cross my heart!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright here’s the hotel the entrance to the garage is on the other side. Park in there. And hey we gotta leave all our guns in the car. The last thing we need is one of Clemente’s goons searching us and finding them. Alright, Vito and me’ll go in and do what needs to be done. You wait for us here. When you hear a big boom, start the car up cause we’re gonna need to get the hell out of here pronto. And you won’t need that gun unless somebody follows us, but that shouldn’t happen.

Speaker: Marty
Text: OK, OK, I got you, Joe.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Clemente rented the entire 18th floor the third one from the top. There’s a couple of suites and conference rooms up there and guards.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So how we gonna get up there?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Round the back through the laundry room.

Speaker: Vito
Text: What, you want to wash your shorts before we do this?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Wiseass. The meeting hasn’t started yet. We’ll grab some hotel worker uniforms, then we’ll go do a little "cleaning" upstairs.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Seriously - when did you become the smart one?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fuck off. There’s supposed to be a guy waiting for us inside with the uniforms. Let’s go. And we don’t want to make a ruckus before Clemente gets here, so don’t go doing nothing stupid.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Haha. Shouldn’t I be telling you that?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Stay here.

Speaker: Marty
Text: Aah…. Always the fucking bridesmaid.
[Vito and Joe go to pick up the uniform.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Ahh shit, it’s closed! The idiot was supposed to leave it open for us! Now we gotta wait and hope that asshole shows up. Fuck!
[Vito finds a way to get to the other side of the gate through the workshops.]

Speaker: Idiot
Text: Look, I’m really sorry I couldn’t get here sooner…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Another minute and you would’ve been late to your own damn funeral.

Speaker: Idiot
Text: Sorry, I was -

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, enough. Just get the hell out of here. See? I got it all under control. C’mon let’s go pick up our uniforms.
[They’re changing into cleaner’s uniforms.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Vito, one more thing… here, put this on.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Are you fucking serious?

Speaker: Joe
Text: So nobody recognizes us, just put it on!
[He’s gluing a mustache.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Great.

Speaker: Joe
Text: OK, let’s go.

Speaker: Gangster
Text: Hey, you two! Get over here! Clean up this fucking mess, you idiots. Clean this shit up, will you? Somebody’s gonna slip and break their neck.
[They’re starting to clean the floor. That’s when the doors of the nearby elevator open. Some poor worker covered in blood is pushed out of it.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Let’s go, move it!

Speaker: Gangster from the elevator
Text: Hey you do. You got some more work upstairs waiting for you. Get moving.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey Richie, come with us.

Speaker: Joe
Text: That was fucking Henry!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, c’mon, let’s get up there before he gets back.
[They’re getting into the elevator.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Haven’t seen Henry in a while.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hasn’t changed a bit.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Haha, yeah. I hope he don’t come back before we do our thing. Henry’s good people, even if he does work for Clemente.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah… but what if he does?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t even think about that…

Speaker: Vito
Text: I feel like an idiot with this thing on my lip.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah? Well, what if we run into somebody we know? This way, they won’t recognize us.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Fucking hope so.
[They’re getting off the elevator.]

Speaker: Gangster 2
Text: About damn time. Where the hill you guys been? Somebody spilled something in the conference room. You’s ain’t gonna ask what it is, or how it got there. You’re just gonna clean it up. There’s a big meeting starting soon, and the boss ain’t gonna be too happy if the place ain’t sparkling by then. So if you’s know what’s good for you, you’ll get the place spick n’ span, and then get the fuck out of there. These two are here to clean up the uh… "mess."

Speaker: Gangster 3
Text: The mess? Oh! That mess… Alright, come on, you two! One of the guys, who was uh, here before. He uh… tripped and fell. The poor guy hit his head pretty hard… About five or six time… So now there’s blood all over the fucking place… And we got a meeting that’s supposed to start soon. So you gotta get this shit cleaned up, and you gotta make it snappy.
[They’re alone in the conference room.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fucking pricks!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, calm down, will yo? They’re not gonna be around to bother you much longer.
[He’s setting up the explosives.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hehe. Yeah. Give me a hand here. Oh shit…. Oh fuck… the yellow… The blue… the plus into plus… the red and match in… negative…oh… the blue… and cross… perfect! Ok. The hard part is almost over.
[They’re scrubbing the blood on the floor so they don’t cause suspicion.]

Speaker: Gangster 3
Text: You miss a spot, asshole… Ah, looks like you’re done. Alright, you’s can get out of here.

Speaker: Joe
Text: OK, now let’s get to the roof.

Speaker: Vito
Text: That’s Clemente! We could take him out right now! If we had a gun…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah, and we’d be dead in two seconds. Just take it easy and stick to the plan. Damn, I ain’t used to this much exercise. Why do they gotta put so many fucking stairs…. Vito… Vito! Hold on, I forgot something. Here, this is for you. Just in case something goes wrong.
[He pulls out a stashed gun.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: This is nice!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Some piece of work, huh? 1911 Cole with a modified dip.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Where the hell did you uh…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Holds twenty-three bullets, so the ammo goes quick. And don’t go losing it. These are the only two in the whole world.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Thanks.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Never mind. We gotta go to the window washing platform, c’mon. Shit! Clemente’s guys.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ah, fuck me. Alright, let’s get outta here.

Speaker: Gangster 3
Text: Oh, this is like an oyster, hold on, hold on, check it out.  Hey, what the fuck are you doing here? Get lost! Shit! They got guns!
[Vito shots him in the head. The second gangster starts shooting.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: OK, Vito, here we go! Be careful, there might be more of them.
[They kill all the gangsters on the roof and raise the window washer’s cradle.]

Speaker: Window Washer
Text: What the hell are you two doing? I wasn’t done with my - oh shit. Jesus OK… OK don’t shoot! I’ll do whatever you say!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, put your hands behind your back. We aint’s gonna hurt you. Here’s some tape, tie him up.

Speaker: Vito
Text: You should consider your self lucky. Everybody else got shot.

Speaker: Joe
Text: OK, get on. We got work to do.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey… how much wire you got?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Enough.

Speaker: Vito
Text: How much is “enough”? Will it reach up to the roof?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Of course not! We’ll just go up one or two floors and blow it.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So much for you being the smart one.

Speaker: Joe
Text: What?

Speaker: Vito
Text: This is crazy. What if the explosion takes us out too?

Speaker: Joe
Text: It won’t. We’ll barely feel it.

Speaker: Vito
Text: We better not. If we fall off of this thing you’re gonna be dead before we hit the ground

Speaker: Joe
Text: OK, this is the right floor. Vito, grab the squeegee and start washing windows so we don’t look suspicious. I gotta connect the wires. Ahh… That’s it. OK, got it. Take us up a bit. Payback’s a bitch. Ahh… Yeah, most like clockwork. Hehehe. Ah, here we go. These assholes ain’t gonna kno…
[Suddenly the explosives goes off.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Jesus, fuck. Uoooh… Oh my God, what the fuck is it?

Speaker: Joe
Text: What the hell was that?

Speaker: Vito
Text: I don’t know… The thing just blew. We’ll barely feel it, alright?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, alright. Lets go take a look.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I don’t know why I fucking listen to you. I swear you’re like a half a retard sometimes. (peels of the mustaches]
[They lower the cradle to conference room. ]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Shit.

Speaker: Alberto Clemente
Text: Ugh! What the… Jesus Christ, I almost pissed on my fucking shoes in here!

Speaker: Vito
Text: What a fucking mess.

Speaker: Alberto Clemente
Text: Felt like a fucking earthquake. What the fuck!  Oh, shit!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Lucky bastard…

Speaker: Alberto Clemente
Text: You assholes. You’re gonna die for this!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fuck, we can’t let him get away! Come on, Vito!
[Clemente’s family boss runs away.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey! We sure mode one hell of a mess.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, but it wasn’t enough. Move it!

Speaker: Alberto Clemente
Text: You… You assholes. I’ll get you’s…
[He shots a waiter.]

Speaker: Waiter
Text: Noo! I didn’t do anything… No!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Must’ve watered down his martini. Watch out! Behind them glass walls! Get that guy with the Tommy! Whoa, easy - that’s top-shelf hooch! All this good booze… going to waste!

Speaker: Vito
Text: I see you with a bottle in your hand, I shoot you myself!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Take the other door, Vito. I got the right side.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Fuck!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Ah, shit! This way, Vito, you won’t get through there! Ahh, fuck! The sprinklers are going off.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Really? ’Cause I thought it was raining…
[Clemente’s running into the elevator.]

Speaker: Gangster
Text: Quick, sir!
[The other elevator is starting to go up to the floor.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fuck! There’s more of them coming! Come on, assholes, I’m waiting for ya… Three… two…
[There’s an old cleaning lady inside.]

Speaker: Lady
Text: Hey, what the heck’s going on here?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Get out of there, lady. We ain’t got nothing against you.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Next time, bring a bigger bomb, will you?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey, how the fuck was supposed to know Clemente would be the bathroom?

Speaker: Vito
Text: He wouldn’t have been if the bomb didn’t go off early.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t worry - we’ll get him.
[They get in the elevator and go down to the parking lot.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Get that asshole on the catwalk! Watch it! Up there!
[Vito and Joe are running out to the parking lot. Clemente and the rest of his men are leaving in a car. Next to their car lies the corpse of their driver.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Marty! No! No! Fuck! They shot him! He’s dead, Vito! Motherfuckers!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, Joe… Joe, come on, we got to get out of here! You can’t help him now. Clemente’s getting away!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Let’s go! I’m gonna kill that fuck! Yeah? You think it’s over? Wrong, assholes! Alright, there’s two of ‘em. If they split up, make sure you follow Clemente, not the other guy.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I know how to drive, alright? Just be ready with the gun!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t worry about that. Just follow Clemente. He’s in the black limo!
[He comes out of the car and starts shooting Clemente’s car with his Tommy.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, Joe. I got eyes too, you know…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Be careful, Vito!!!
[As soon as Vito catches up with Clemente’s car, Joe shoots the head of a mafia clan.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: That’s the end of him.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Can’t be sure unless to check.
[Joe gets out of the car reloading his tommy. He shoots Clemente’s car.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: This is for Marty. Now it’s over. Let’s go to my place.
[At Joe’s apartment…]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Eh, you wanna beer? Eh?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Give me Eddie’s number. I’ll call him.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hello?

Speaker: Joe
Text: This is Joe. It’s done.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Everything went smooth?

Speaker: Vito
Text: No. It didn’t.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Why?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Marty’s dead.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: What?

Speaker: Joe
Text: They got Marty, we left him there!

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Uh, OK- OK - what about Clemente?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Done.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Alright! Hey don’t worry about the kid, small price to pay. The main thing is it’s done.

Speaker: Joe
Text: S… sm… small price? That’s my fucking friend you’re talking about!

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hey, Joe don’t go taking it out on me! Calm down now, Joe. Joe, take it easy. Hey, Joe, don’t go taking it out on me! It was your idea and nobody forced the kid to go. I’m sorry but shit happens, right? Come by the Falcon tomorrow to get your money.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah… whatever.  The fuck you’re sorry!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, take it easy now, alright? Calm down. I’m sorry too. More than you think, but you knew the risks.

Speaker: Joe
Text: You too?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, this was a dangerous job. You took him along, he died. What you think the war was any different? And Eddie didn’t even know the kid, so don’t blame him.

Speaker: Joe
Text: You should go home.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ok, well… Just give me a minute to get changed.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Eh… I’m sorry kid, I am so sorry.
[Vito goes to Villa Scaletta and goes to sleep. At night, he wakes up from a phone call.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hello?

Speaker: Man
Text: Yeah, uh, i-is this uh, Vito?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Who’s asking?

Speaker: Man
Text: Name’s Leon. I’m the bartender at the Lone Star. I’m ringing you ’cause Joe Barbaro gave me your number. Says he’s a friend of yours?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, what about him?

Speaker: Leon
Text: Well, old Joe been guzzling my top-shelf hooch all night long dribblin’ on about some cat named Marty, and now he done just gone plain salty on me.

Speaker: Vito
Text: What the hell are you talking about?

Speaker: Leon
Text: Your friend is out of control, man! He all waving his gun around and shit, and we can’t talk no sense to him.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Great…

Speaker: Leon
Text: Now look, I ain’t looking for no trouble with you fellas. Could you please come pick his drunk ass up before he shoots somebody, or somebody calls the police? Vito, you got to come on down here and pick his ass up! You comin’ or not?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, I’1l be right there. And hey! Don’t give him any more booze ’ill get there.

Speaker: Leon
Text: I’m a dry, but your friend, he ain’t gonna be down with that, you dig?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey if you don’t cut him off right now, I’m gonna cut you off when I get there, got it?

Speaker: Leon
Text: Alright man, alright. Just hurry!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, how many people are in the bar right now?

Speaker: Leon
Text: Just me now. Joint was jumping about an hour ago, but now everybody done gone and split!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, listen - lock the place up ’til I get there. I’ll be there in a minute.

Speaker: Leon
Text: OK, gotcha.
[Vito dresses up and goes to the bar.]

Speaker: Leon
Text: Vito, you here!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, where is he?

Speaker: Leon
Text: Over in the corner there. Now look I tried to cut him off, but the motherfucker was gonna air my ass out if I did!

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK. Lock that door and just give me a minute with him.
[Vito’s coming up to the table that Joe’s sitting at. He’s holding a gun, and he’s clearly drunk.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Had a couple, huh? How you feeling?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Vito! About time you showed up. Everybody went home already…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Gee, Joe, I wonder why?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Oh… Heh… Right.

Speaker: Vito
Text: You drive here?

Speaker: Joe
Text: No, I took a cab! I wouldn’t park my car in this neighborhood.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, finish your drink and let’s go.

Speaker: Leon
Text: You fellas about to leave? I’ll let you out.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Well, Marty. Here’s to you kid. You went out like a man.
[He drinks from a huge bottle of whiskey.]

Speaker: Leon
Text: Shit, now where’d I put my keys?

Speaker: Joe
Text: I’m so sorry kid.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ehm… Ehm…

Speaker: Joe
Text: This never should’ve happened. Never should’ve happened!
[He’s knocking a gun on the table and it’s shooting unexpectedly.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Wow, Jesus!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ahh shit.
[Leon falls on the floor.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: You gotta be kidding me.  What… the fuck… is wrong with you?!

Speaker: Joe
Text: I was just…

Speaker: Vito
Text: You were just what? Shut your fucking mouth, and get your drunk ass outside!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright… Alright… I’m going…
[Vito drags the body to the bartender’s car and take Joe home.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, we’re here. Try not to shoot anybody on the way to the front door, huh?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Thanks, Vito. And hey, I’m sorry about -

Speaker: Vito
Text: Look, just… Call me tomorrow, OK?
[Vito dumps the body and goes to his home to sleep the rest of the night.]
[Vito wakes up from the doorbell.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Who the hell is that?
[When he walks out the door, he sees Henry Tomasino.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey, Vito, long time no see.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Sure. Long time. What do you want, Henry?

Speaker: Henry
Text: A drink. Let’s take my car.
[They get in the car and leave.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Well, I guess you know Clemente’s dead, along with everybody else. Listen, Vito, I know Falcone had something to do with this. And, I’m worried that he’s gonna wanna take out what’s left of the family.

Speaker: Vito
Text: And I should care about this why?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Well… yeah. Look, about you going away… I’m sorry for what Clemente did to you… But he got what was coming to him, right? I don’t give a rot’s ass about that old bastard. Matter of fact, I’d work for Falcone just the same…

Speaker: Vito
Text: You’re saying you want to join up with us?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah, and since you work for him I thought uh, maybe… You think you could put in a good word for me?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, sure. Me and Joe can vouch for you.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Thanks, Vito. I owe you one.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So uh, how’s life?

Speaker: Henry
Text: You mean before or after half the guys I know got killed? That business at the hotel, you wouldn’t know anything about that would you?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Got no idea what you’re talking about…

Speaker: Henry
Text: That’s funny, ’cause a buddy of Joe’s got popped in the parking lot that day, so I just figured you two were in on it…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Buddy of Joe’s? Who you talking about?

Speaker: Henry
Text: You know that fuckin’ kid used to come into Freddy’s with Joe all the time - what’s his came uh, Mikey, uh, Micky… Whatever the fuck his name was…

Speaker: Vito
Text: You mean Marty?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah yeah, that’s the kid. Kid has a voice like fucking Minnie Mouse.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah yeah, I heard about that…

Speaker: Henry
Text: So you’re sure you weren’t there that day. You’re positive…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Let’s put it this way - me and Joe were out taking care of something for our boss that day. That’s all I’m gonna say.

Speaker: Henry
Text: You know what? It don’t matter anyway. But do me a favor, would you?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, sure.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Next time get a better disguise than a phony fucking moustache. I saw you two pricks from a mile away…

Speaker: Vito
Text: You know what, can we please not talk about this right now? Or ever again.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Don’t worry about it. You did what you had to do.

Speaker: Vito
Text: You ever get the feeling you’d be better off in a different line of work?

Speaker: Henry
Text: To be honest with you, not really. This is what I am. What I’m good at.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah… And I guess it pays a hell of a lot better than being a fucking taxi driver.

Speaker: Henry
Text: I was thinking about skipping town after that business of the hotel, but where am I gonna go? What am I gonna do? That’s why I came to see you.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So I was your last resort, huh? Thanks. Hey, not for nothing how come you come to see me and not Joe?
[They enters the Maltese Falcon.]

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hey, Vito.

Speaker: Vito
Text: You got that money for me?

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Always keep my word, don’t I? Here you go. Don’t spend it all in one place.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Thanks. Where’s Joe?

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Uh. He was here before, but then he left. Looked pissed off. Though lately, he always looks pissed off.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah. Can you blame him? Listen, uh… I need to talk to you about something.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: What? Is it important? I’m busy with Vinci right now. He’s planning to make a move on us and we don’t know how or why… I-I… I gotta sort this shit out.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, well, I think it’s worth hearing me out.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: All right, go ahead. But make it quick.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, a guy I know who worked for Clemente called me. He’s worried. He’s not sure if we’ll be going after the rest of Clemente’s guys or not.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hehe, oh that’s good. As far as I know, the boss ain’t planning nothing of this point. Unless they try something stupid.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK. Well this guy also asked me if he could come work for us.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Yeah? Who is it? What is he a friend of yours?

Speaker: Vito
Text: I did a few jobs with him for Clemente. Really knows his shit.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Yeah… OK. Tell him to stop by.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Well, uh. He’s here right now.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hahaha, he is? Alright, go get him then…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Eddie this is Henry Tomasino. Henry, this is Eddie Scarpa.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Pleased to meet you, Mr. Scarpa.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Don’t call me Mr. Scarpa. My friends call me Eddie. And take a seat, Henry. So, Vito tells me you want to join up with us.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah, I’m out of work right now, and I don’t want to make a big deal out of what happened.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Now, that’s good thinking. Tell me something first, Henry - were Clemente and Vinci planning anything against our organization?

Speaker: Henry
Text: OK… I usually keep my nose out of things like that. But I was with Luca Gurino once at Leo Galante’s place and Luca was going on and on about Falcone being involved in some dirty business and that something should be done about it. I think he was trying to turn Vinci against you.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: That bastard! bet he was talking about drugs all the while he’s dealing them himself. He knows that Vinci is totally against this. Yeah, probably fooled the old man good. So that’s why he’s plannin’ to move on us… Now, we gotta hit him first.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Again?!

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Hey, if we don’t act, Frank will. First we’ve got to get rid of Galante. Without him, Frank’s fucked.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Leo!?

Speaker: Eddie
Text: I wanted to keep you out of it, but I didn’t have anybody else who could pull off a job like this. Now I’m thinking this could be the perfect opportunity for Henry here to prove himself. What do you say, Henry, you up for it?

Speaker: Henry
Text: If it means I’m in when the job’s done, sure…

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Exactly! Take care of Leo. And what about you, Vito? I’d feel a lot better if you went with Henry to make sure everything goes smooth. I don’t mean you gotta whack the guy. Just drive there, wait until it’s done and drive back. But if it don’t feel right I can ask somebody else instead. What do you say?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Sorry, Eddie. I can’t do this. Leo was like a father to me back in the can.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: Yeah, I understand. Well, looks like you gotta take care of this yourself, Henry. You can hire some help if you want, but you gotta do this so nobody suspects it was us. Leo lives in Highbrook.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Got it. Don’t worry. It’ll be done today.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: OK, you better get going then.

Speaker: Henry
Text: See you later, Eddie.
[He leaves.]

Speaker: Eddie
Text: It’s a good thing you brought him here. Even if he screws up, nobody will know it was us.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I don’t think Henry’s gonna screw it up.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: That’s good. Well, Vito, got nothing else for you today, but, drop by tomorrow, OK?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah. I’ll see you later, Eddie.

Speaker: Eddie
Text: See you.
[Vito decides to make something stupid for a change and warn Leo Galante. He goes all the way to his mansion, breaking the gates and running into the hallway screaming.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Leo! Leo, you here!?
[Leo didn’t appreciate the heroic deed and thought it was going to be robbed.]

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: How the hell did you get in here!? Get out of here or I’ll shove this gun up your ass.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Leo, Leo, put it away. It’s me, Vito!

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Vito? What the hell are you doing here? You could have called first…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Leo, there’s no time to talk, you gotta get out of here quick, they’re after you!

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: What? Come upstairs, Vito, my feet are getting cold. Want a drink?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Do I want a drink? What the fuck is wrong with you?
[Vito walks back and forth through the room like a virgin on a first date. Leo sits quietly in a chair.]

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: OK, so what’s happening?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Look, Falcone wants you dead. The guys are on their way. You gotta get out of here!

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: What? Why the hell would I do that?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Look, Falcone heard Vinci’s planning to make a move on him, because Clemente lied and said that he was in the dope business.

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Lied?! Vito Carlo Falcone is in the dope business. Everybody knows that. Clemente tried to muscle his way into the business, so Falcone got rid of him. Now he wants to get rid of us to… Before we make a move on him.

Speaker: Vito
Text: How do you know all this?

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: I got my sources. Why did you come here again?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Why?! What are you getting senile on me? Because they’re going to kill you! Stop talking for Chrissake, get dressed and let’s go.

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Why don’t we just get rid of whoever Carlo sent to whack me? We got the advantage. They don’t know we’re expecting them.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I can’t do that. I know the guy… I’m actually the one who got him the job.

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: What? You hired your friend to whack me?

Speaker: Vito
Text: No, not exactly. Look I don’t have time to explain. He’s gonna be here any minute!

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: OK. Wait here, I’ll get dressed.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Shit, too late, they’re here. Oh, shit… Henry can’t see me here! We gotta hide - quick, before he comes up here. Hey… We could hide under the bed!

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: You gone nuts?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, maybe we can hide in the shower.
[Soon Vito’s brilliant plans are over - Henry finds them.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Vito!? What the hell are you doing here?!

Speaker: Vito
Text: All right, take it easy, Henry. Put the gun down and send the guys away. I’m gonna explain everything.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Boys! Wait for me outside! If I don’t come out in a few minutes, come looking for me. Take a seat. What the hell is going on here?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Look, Henry, Leo is a friend of mine, alright? He helped me out when I was in prison, he pretty much saved my life… And he’s the reason I got made. Look, I didn’t know Eddie was going to put a contract out on him. I had to warn him, you gotta understand!

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah, but you gotta understand that I can’t afford to screw this up. If I let Leo go, Falcone will think I fucked him on purpose and he’ll have me killed.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Dammit, Henry, I’m your friend here! I’d do the same thing for you and you know it!

Speaker: Henry
Text: This has nothing to do with friendship, Vito. This business, and if I screw up, I’m done. I can’t let him go. I took a contract and I gotta finish the job. If you don’t wanna watch you can leave. And don’t worry about me. I won’t tell anybody you were here.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Look, Leo told me that all of this is because Falcone’s into drugs! He’s breaking the rules and he wants to get rid of anybody who knows about it!

Speaker: Henry
Text: So what? The only people who aren’t breaking those rules are Frank Vinci and Leo here. And those aren’t the people who pay me.

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Vito… Thanks for everything, but leave us now. I’ve had a long and good life. It’s not worth risking your neck to buy an old man a few more years.

Speaker: Vito
Text: No, Leo! There’s got to be a way…

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Vito… Go.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Sorry, Vito. I won’t tell anybody you were here. Just make sure nobody sees you leave.
[Vito comes out of the room and smokes a cigarette. A shot is heard. Henry leaves the room.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: You owe me big for this one, pal.

Speaker: Vito
Text: What?

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Hey, kid.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Leo?!

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: You want a drink?

Speaker: Vito
Text: What the hell happened?

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Your friend and I made a deal. I’m gonna disappear. There’s nothing left for me in this town anyway since my wife passed. And I was planning to retire someplace warm anyway. Well, first, let’s get out of here before your friend charges his mind. OK, Vito, now get me over to the train station if you wouldn’t mind. This town’s been good to me, but now it’s time to say goodbye.

Speaker: Vito
Text: You gonna go there in your PJ’s?

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Damn right I am. I’d rather be drive in my pajamas than dead in a three-piece suit.

Speaker: Vito
Text: You uh, gonna tell Frank what happened?

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Sure I am, but don’t worry ain’t gonna mention your name. You’re going to have enough to worry about as it is.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Thanks, Leo. You know this whole thing got – complicated – real fast. You know?

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: Of course, it did Vito… What’d you expect you swear the oath, you put on a fancy suit, and then it’s one big party? Carlo’s always been a shady bastard, even for guys in this business. I’ve been warning Frank about him for years.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So what are you gonna do now?

Speaker: Leo Galante
Text: I’m gonna disappear let things to their course Gonna take the first train to Lost Heoven Make a few phone calls, settle my affairs. Then I’m gonna head for the airport and I’m gonna go some are warm. This time tomorrow I’m gonna be sitting on a beach somewhere sipping one of them fruity drinks will the umbrella in ‘em. Alright, here it is. Thanks for everything Vito Just promise me that you’re never going to be as stupid as you were today. Risking your neck like this just to buy an old man a few more years…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Enjoy your vocation, old man.
[He goes home and finds his sister sitting on his doorstep.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Frankie, what are you doing here?

Speaker: Francesca
Text: Vito, I don’t know what to do. I can’t go back home. I don’t want to see him ever again.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Whoo, what happened? See who?

Speaker: Francesca
Text: Eric!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Your husband? Why?

Speaker: Francesca
Text: He drinks, and he parties all the time… And he…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Whoa, whoa… Does he hit you?

Speaker: Francesca
Text: No, but he’s seeing somebody… I know he is.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Does he hit you?

Speaker: Francesca
Text: Sometimes…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Son of a bitch, I’ll kill him!

Speaker: Francesca
Text: No, Vito! Please don’t hurt him. I just thought you could talk to him. He’ll listen to you!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Where is he?

Speaker: Francesca
Text: I don’t know. He has a friend who lives on on River Street. That’s usually where he is.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK, OK, alright, it’s gonna be alright. Alright listen, hey, hey, when you feel better you go on home. I’ll talk to Eric. If that bastard doesn’t come back today and apologize, you call me. But don’t worry. I have a feeling he will.

Speaker: Francesca
Text: OK, Vito, but please don’t hurt him, please…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Don’t worry. I’ll go talk some sense into him, OK?
[He goes to River Street apartment. He finds Eric at another party in the arms of a half-naked girl.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Eric?

Speaker: Eric
Text: What the fuck do you think you’re doing? I’m busy here, OK? Get lost.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I think you should be "busy" taking care of your wife, asshole!
[He hits him over the head with an empty champagne bottle.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: I’ll teach you to hit a woman!
[He’s beating up Eric pretty good.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Consider this a warning, you touch my sister again I will fucking kill you! Alright?

Speaker: Eric
Text: Yeah…

Speaker: Vito
Text: From now on, you’re going to stay home, stay off the dope, stop the drinking, and make sure she’s fucking happy. If I ever, ever her she’s not happy. I’ll find you and finish the fucking job. You got it?

Speaker: Eric
Text: Ehh, yeah.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK, everybody, party’s over! And there won’t be any more partying with this guy again, ever! Unless you want me to come back and do the same to the rest of you’s, got it?!
[He’s going home. When he walks into the house, he hears a phone call and picks up the phone.]

Speaker: Francesca
Text: Vito, it’s Francesca. Eric come home and he’s all beat up. You said you wouldn’t hurt him!

Speaker: Vito
Text: He probably got in a fight. You know he’s been hanging out with a very bad crowd.

Speaker: Francesca
Text: He apologized for everything, Vito. He promised he’ll be good to me. It’s all ok now. So, you’ll leave him alone, won’t ya?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, whatever you want. But it he hurts you again, I’ll kill him.

Speaker: Francesca
Text: Listen to yourself, Vito! I-I-I don’t know you anymore. Look, you, you stay away from us, you understand? Just, just… Stay away!
[Vito, go to bed. At night three cars approach his house…]

Speaker: Thug
Text: Torch the place! Do it now! Burn, you dago cunt. Burn! Hahahahaha!
[They’re throwing Molotov cocktails at Vito’s house. It’s burning up.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: My house! Fuck!
[He’s gets out the window in his underwear and running to Joe’s house under fire.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: C’mon, Joe! Don’t tell me you’re not home. Let’s go! You better not be passed out. C’mon!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hold your horses, I’m coming, I’m coming… What, were you barbecuing in your underwears?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah. Can I come in?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Oh! Yeah, yeah, of course, I’ll fix you a drink.
[Vito’s noticing that Joe’s done some redecoration.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: What the fuck…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Nice, ain’t it?

Speaker: Vito
Text: What the hell happened to this place?

Speaker: Joe
Text: I spruced the joint up a little. What do you think?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, it’s really uh… Different.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah, huh? I decorated it myself! So what the hell happened? Here, take this. (gives him a glass of whiskey]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Those crazy fucking micks.

Speaker: Joe
Text: What about ‘em? What did they do??

Speaker: Vito
Text: They tried to fucking kill me!

Speaker: Joe
Text: What?!

Speaker: Vito
Text: And they burned my fucking house down.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Son of a bitch… So what are you gonna do? You want to go deal with the micks right now?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Damn right I do.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright. Relax, have a drink, let me make a few phone calls. And uh take a look in my closet. Unless you want to go on a rampage in your skivves.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Thanks. Thought you’d never ask.
[The only thing in the closet is that Joe wears - a red shirt with flowers and trousers.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Oh, great. A fucking clown suit. Can get down to any worse?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey. It’s Joe. Yeah, I know, I know. But I need a favor. A bunch of micks tried to kill a good friend of mine tonight. Burned his house down. I wanna know who they are and where they’re operating out of.
[Meanwhile, Vito is looking at Joe’s apartment.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ah, the bed’s not too bad. Wow kitchen’s pink too…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey. You’re gonna have a lot worse to worry about if you don’t tell me. Mickey Desmond… Oh, oh, he is. Well, that explains it. Where she now?

Speaker: Vito
Text: (about Joe’s bathroom) Now THIS place deserves to be burnt down.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah, yeah, I know the place. Alright, thanks.  Hey, you finally got some style. I’m gonna want that shirt back by the way they do make threads like these no more.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, there’s a reason for that you know. Where we going?

Speaker: Joe
Text: The Hill of Tara, the mick point in Kingston. C’mon, I’ll tell you the most in the car.
[They’re getting into the car. Vito drives as usual.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright… so you heard anything about the micks lately?

Speaker: Vito
Text: No, nothing. Why?

Speaker: Joe
Text: The micks got themselves a new boss, name’s Mickey Desmond. There’s a few other guys who want to take his spot, so he’s trying to show everybody that he means business.

Speaker: Vito
Text: What the hell does that have to do with me?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Brian O’Neill. He was Desmond’s cousin.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ahh, should’ve known.

Speaker: Joe
Text: My money’s on him being down at that shithole joint right now, laughing it up with the rest of those fuckin’ yo-yos.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So, let’s get over there and deal with him.

Speaker: Joe
Text: That’s the plan. Sounds like there ain’t many of ‘em left, so I guess we should just storm the place. Surprise the shit out of ‘em.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I like this plan. Assholes… Burnt my fucking house down…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Relax, we’ll be there in a minute. Shit, you’re gonna need a piece. I almost forgot.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, if you got one that would be good. If not, I’ll just beat ‘em to death with my bare hands. Makes no difference to me.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Should be one in here somewhere… Ah, here it is, here you go.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Thanks.
[He’s pulling up to the café.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Ready, Vito? C’mon, let’s go get these fucks.

Speaker: Thug
Text: I told you! I chased him, but I lost him! That coward ran away! But I’ll find him, and when I do…

Speaker: Vito
Text: You were the one who ran away, asshole.

Speaker: Thug
Text: Ah fuck! You… You’ve got some balls…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yes, I do.
[He kills everyone in the café.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, there’s more of ‘em in that car! Let’s go, they’re getting away.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, come on. You drive.
[Vito catches up with them and shoots them in the head.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: That takes care of that. Stupid fucks…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Well, that takes care of that, huh?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah. But it don’t give me my house back.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t worry. Business is looking good, you’ll have the cash for a new one real soon.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, I sure as hell hope so.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, let’s go back home.

Speaker: Vito
Text: So, it’s ok if I crash on your couch, right?

Speaker: Joe
Text: I can do one better than that. Here, take these keys. They’re for Marty’s apartment. I’m trying to get rid of it right now for his mother. So uh, you might as well use it while I do.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Thanks. I guess.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t thank me buddy. You’re too old to be sleeping on my couch. Plus I just bought the thing. I don’t want you lousing it up. Marty’s apartment’s over in Oyster Bay. So, you feel better now?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Not really. What we did back there doesn’t even start to make up for it.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey, all that stuff that got burnt up, it’s just things, Vito.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Just things? Hey, those were my things, Joe. Why do you think I do the shit we do anyways? It’s to buy things, ya know, suits, cars, broads, houses. Now I’m back to scratch. And all my damn cash was in that house too. I promised myself I’d never be poor again, end up a fucking wharf rat like my old man.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey, hey, I understand. Don’t worry, we’ll think of something. You’ll be back on your feet in no time.

Speaker: Vito
Text: The glass is always fucking half full with you, isn’t it? OK, I’ll see ya around, I guess…

Speaker: Joe
Text: See ya, buddy. Sorry about tonight.
[Vito goes to Marty’s apartment.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: What a fucking dump. God, wish I had the cash for a hotel. (looking at girls pics near Marty’s bed) Fuck, this is creepy.
[Suppressing disgust, Vito goes to bed.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: My house burnt to the ground, along with almost every penny I had. There was even some trouble with the cops, but Eddie took care of that. And since I didn’t have any insurance, I had to live in this shithole of an apartment ’til I could get back on my feet… At least I managed to save Leo. He disappeared without a trace. I doubt Frank Vinci ever knew where he went. And even though Henry failed to deliver on the contract, Eddie still brought him in when he heard Leo had skipped town. Me and Joe had a new partner.
[Vito picks up ringing phone.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey, Vito, it’s Henry.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Listen, I’m setting up something big - I want you to come in on it. If you’re interested in hearing more, come meet me at Lincoln Park. And bring a piece.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK. I’ll see you there.
[He drives to Lincoln Park.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey, here he comes.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey.

Speaker: Vito
Text: What’s up?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey, Vito, take a seat. Alright, listen. I’ve been doing some research into Carlo’s business.

Speaker: Joe
Text: So?

Speaker: Henry
Text: So, the only reason he had Clemente killed was because he was selling dope too and he was stealing his customers. Now he just needs to get rid of one last obstacle. The one guy who could fuck things up and ruin his plan to become the main supplier for the whole city. Frank Vinci.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Where’d you get all this?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I talked to a few people I trust.

Speaker: Joe
Text: OK, so what does this have to do with us?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Because… if he can do it, why can’t we? A kilo of heroin costs twenty-hundred bucks over in France. Then it’s another thousand bucks to get it here.

Speaker: Joe
Text: And?

Speaker: Henry
Text: And we pickup eleven grand for just driving the stuff to the dealers! That’s seventy-five hundred bucks profit a kilo!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hmmm.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, but what about Falcone?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Carlo won’t find out. And even if he does, he’ll just threaten us and demand a cut.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, but if Carlo’s the only big supplier in the city, where are you going to buy the stuff from?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I’m way ahead of you. What do you two know about the Tongs?

Speaker: Joe
Text: The chinks?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Some kind of organization for Chinese immigrants, right?

Speaker: Joe
Text: That’s what I said, the chinks.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Right. But it’s also a front for their "other" operations. They run the Chinese quotes, and they keep to themselves. But some of them are interested in doing business with outsiders, and they need middlemen since most people are afraid to deal with them.

Speaker: Vito
Text: And we’re the middlemen…

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah. They’ll give us ten kilos to start.

Speaker: Joe
Text: For how much?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Thirty-five grand.

Speaker: Joe
Text: And we can sell it for?

Speaker: Henry
Text: A hundred and ten.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Nice…

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK, well, where the hell we are we going to get our hands on thirty-five grand?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I know a loan shark. The Yid over on Palisade. I think he’ll loan us thirty-five if we give him forty-five back. Now that means our take is over twenty grand apiece. Not bad for just moving the shit from one place to another.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah… But you know, who’s going to end up using this crap?

Speaker: Henry
Text: What do you care? As long as it isn’t in our neighborhood.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Because Vinci was right! Drugs are bad news, they kill people.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Look, only idiots do drugs - deadbeats and losers. If they wanna kill themselves so badly, I’ll gladly help them out. Especially for twenty grand. I got buyers in the ghetto. They’ll take core of the distribution, so we don’t need to worry about that. Are you guys in or not?

Speaker: Joe
Text: I’m in. C’mon, don’t be stupid, Vito. Twenty fucking grand in one afternoon!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ah… When?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Right now. If we don’t take the offer the Tongs will just find somebody else.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Come on, Vito, it’ll be a piece of cake.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Let’s go see Bruno then. Vito, how about you run us all down there. He’s on Palisade Street.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK, let’s go.
[They’re going to Southport to visit the loan shark.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: So who is this guy we’re going to see, Henry?

Speaker: Henry
Text: His name’s Bruno. He’s one of the only guys in town who can do a loan this big.

Speaker: Vito
Text: What if he doesn’t give it to us, then what?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Then the deal’s off. But don’t worry, I know this guy. He’ll give us the money.

Speaker: Joe
Text: There ain’t nobody else we can get this kinda money from

Speaker: Henry
Text: There’s three other guys that I know of. But if you want to ask Carlo or Frank Vinci for thirty-five grand, be my guest.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, no thanks.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Who’s the third guy?

Speaker: Henry
Text: He ain’t in business no more. Somebody blew up a room full of his guys then shot him point bank in the face with a Tommy gun.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Oh, that guy.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Come on. We said we wasn’t gonna talk about that.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright. So, Henry, what is this guy rich or something?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I think he gets his money from some of the bosses from out of town who sit on the Commission

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah? No shit!

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah. Which is why we can’t stiff the guy… Besides, we gotta keep this quet.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Can we trust him?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Sure. Wiseguys been borrowing money from this guy forever. Long as we pay him back on time, we won’t have a problem. Alright, stop right here, Vito.
[They’re walking down a narrow alley and Henry’s knocking on the iron door. A gloomy face looks out of the flap.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hi, fellas. We’re here to see Bruno.
[The door opens and the guys go inside.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Hiya, Henry. If you got guns on you’s, put ‘em down there. I gotta search you’s.
[After the search, they come to the table where sits a middle-aged man with small round glasses. His eyes, voice and behavior immediately shows experience and intelligence.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hiya, Bruno.

Speaker: Bruno
Text: Hello, Henry. So, to what do I owe the pleasure of your company today?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I need thirty-five grand in twenty dollar bills.

Speaker: Bruno
Text: Ah, that’s a lot of money, Henry, a lot of money. Tell me, why should I give that much too smalltime guy like you, huh? Convince me.

Speaker: Henry
Text: I got o sure thing. You’ll have forty-five by the end of the week.

Speaker: Bruno
Text: What kind of sure thing?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Sorry, Bruno That’s a trade secret.

Speaker: Bruno
Text: Then forty-five is not enough. I’d be more comfortable with sixty-five.

Speaker: Henry
Text: That’s a bit sleep, even for you. Fifty is all I can do.

Speaker: Bruno
Text: Henry, Henry… I have no guarantee I’ll get my money back, and you have nowhere else to go. So… How about sixty? Don’t think of it as interest, it’s more like my cut of the profits.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Fifty five, final offer. Anything more than that, it’s not worth my time,

Speaker: Bruno
Text: Deal. I’ll give you thirty-five thousand dollars today and you’ll give me fifty-five thousand by Friday. If you don’t pay it back by then, the debt goes up by ten thousand every week.

Speaker: Henry
Text: You’ll get it by Friday.

Speaker: Bruno
Text: OK. Isaac, prepare thirty-five thousand dollars in twenty dollar bills. Now you know I trust ya, Henry. But if you screw me remember these wise words from the Bible: And my wrath shall wax hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Exodus, Chapter 22, Verse 24.

Speaker: Bruno
Text: Hehehe. I’m impressed. You don’t seem like the churchgoing type. Eh, but just remember, the money isn’t mine, so even if you get rid of me that doesn’t get rid of your debt. So no funny business, OK, boys?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Sure, Bruno.
[Bruno’s man brings him a suitcase.]

Speaker: Bruno
Text: Thank you, Isaac. You want to count it, Henry?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I’ll take your word for it. And I’ll bring it back on Friday along with your "cut".

Speaker: Bruno
Text: I hope so. Good luck, boys.
[The guys go out of the building and go to the Sea Gift warehouse.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Nice job Henry.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Of course. I told you he’d give us the dough, didn’t I?

Speaker: Joe
Text: So, how come you know the Bible so good, Henry. You read it or something

Speaker: Henry
Text: Bruno always uses the same quote. I go to church on Sundays, so I asked the priest one time.

Speaker: Joe
Text: You go to church?!

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah, and I can understand why you don’t. They use big words, there’s no hookers, and the food’s lousy.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah, that pretty much sums it up.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Jeez, I ain’t been there since ’45.

Speaker: Joe
Text: What that time your mother more you go to confession?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah, that time she smacked me for checking out some chick’s coolie. Ah, God rest her soul.

Speaker: Vito
Text: How about you Joe? How long’s it been?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Easter…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ah, that ain’t too bad.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I take that back then. You’re going straight to hell. What you’re just figuring that out now?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t worry, I’ll save seats for the both of you’s… You know I heard about a loan shark named Bruno once, must be the same guy.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah. What did you hear?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Well, you know Micky the Crab, right?

Speaker: Vito
Text: What, the guy who cleans the bathroom of Carlo’s joint?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah, the guy who’s only got a finger and thumb on his left hand. Guess how that happened? I heard he owed a lot of money to some yid from Southport. You get my drift?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Oh, right, I get the picture.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Haha, don’t worry, though. Crab’s a moron, nutn’ like that’s gonna happen to us.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Alright, we’re almost there. Drive through the gate, and into the yard.
[Once they get into the warehouse, they get out of the car.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Alright, follow me, fellas. And let me do all the talking. Hey. We got some business with your boss.

Speaker: Chinese guy
Text: Greetings, Mister Tomasino.
[He’s taking the guys to the room behind the warehouse. They are searched again.]

Speaker: Chinese Boss
Text: Welcome, Henry.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hello, Mr. Wong.

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: Let us get straight to business. Is your suitcase heavy enough?

Speaker: Henry
Text: See for yourself.

Speaker: Chinese Guy
Text: Eleven pounds of twenty-dollar bills sir. Thirty-five thousand dollars.

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: Alright, take it away and bring the goods. You’re a good man, Henry. Here is your "merchandise." Each bag contains one kilo. Each kilo weighs a little more than two pounds. Which one do you want to test?
[Henry checks the weight and quality of the "product" by trying it from a knife.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: OK, we’re good.

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: I’m glad. Next time, we can give you twice the amount.

Speaker: Henry
Text: It was a pleasure doing business with you, Mr. Wong.

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: The pleasure was all mine.
[Henry’s handing over a suitcase with powder to Joe. He teases him, bowing in Chinese way.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Knock it off. See how easy that was? Let’s get back in the car.
[They’re coming out of the building.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Alright, fellas. The hard port’s over. Now we just gotta make the exchange and we’re done.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Sounds good to me…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Where we headed?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hunters. I got it all lined up.
[On the way out of the alley, they’re met by a lot of cops armed with machine guns.]

Speaker: Policeman
Text: Hello, gentlemen.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fucking setup.

Speaker: Policeman
Text: I think you have something for us. Drop the suitcases.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hmm, nice shoes!

Speaker: Henry
Text: Wait a minute, these guys ain’t cops!

Speaker: Policeman
Text: Kill the bastards!

Speaker: Henry
Text: Shoot, Vito!
[There’s a big shootout coming in.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Vito, watch our back! Here comes more of ‘em!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hold on… I got him… Bingo.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Nice, but there’s still too many of ‘em. Come on!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Aw shit, can’t go back that way… Run!

Speaker: Henry
Text: Move your asses! Vito, watch our back! Stay away from these windows, fellas.

Speaker: Joe
Text: No sense staying up here! Lets get down there!

Speaker: Henry
Text: Vito! Kick the door in!

Speaker: Joe
Text: These guys just don’t fucking learn…
[They make their way to the car, get into it and drive away, breaking through the warehouse gates.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Shit, that was fucking close…
[They’re being chased right away.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: It’s not over yet! They’re coming after us.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fuck, lose ‘em!
[Henry and Joe are having a real shootout with the thugs. Vito comes off the chase.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: What the fuck was that, Henry?

Speaker: Henry
Text: No idea. Somebody else must have known about the deal. Those definitely weren’t real cops.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Maybe it was the chinks trying to fuck us?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I doubt it look. I’ll figure it out, but first we gotta unload this stuff. Vito, take us to the old warehouse in Hunters.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright. Hope this next deal goes better than the last one.

Speaker: Henry
Text: It will. Not like it could go any worse, right?

Speaker: Vito
Text: So who we selling the stuff to?

Speaker: Henry
Text: A bunch of different guys.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Who who whoa! What do you mean "a bunch of different guys"?

Speaker: Henry
Text: A bunch of different guys. What did all that shooting back there make you deaf?

Speaker: Vito
Text: I thought you said we were just moving this garbage from one place to another.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Yeah, well ya make a lot more money if ya sell it in smaller amounts.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Would’ve been really nice to know before I agreed to go in on this.

Speaker: Henry
Text: If I did, from the way you were talking back in the park, you probably wouldn’t have.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah. Exactly.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey, the best you could hope for right now is to spend the next 30 years of your life breakin’ your ass for Eddie and Carlo before you either get bumped off or end up back in the con. The only time you’re ever gonna see cash like this is if you stick your neck out. Besides, I ever steer you wrong?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Well… There was the OPA job and that time we almost got killed when we whacked that fat fuck in Sand Island.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Alright alright, enough. None of that matters after today. Let’s just get to Hunters. And don’t worry, we’re never gonna have to see these scumbags again after today.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Unless this turns into a regular thing for us…

Speaker: Vito
Text: Whoa… Alright, let’s just concentrate on getting through this one before we go making plans like that, alright?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey, I’m just saying…

Speaker: Henry
Text: Vito’s right. Let’s just get through the rest of the day. After that, smooth sailing, fellas. Here we are. Let me do the talking. These are tough guys so no wiseass comments. Alright, Joe?
[They get out of the car and come to the front door, where there are two black guys smoking weed.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey, guys, how are you doing?

Speaker: Guard
Text: Hey, man. Come on in.
[Joe’s asking me to let him have a joint. He makes a puff and starts coughing.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Shit, good smoke, fuck…
[Some time later, our novice drug dealers leave the building.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: We did it! We hit the jackpot…
[He starts dancing.]

Speaker: Henry
Text: Hey hey hey, take it easy, we’re not done yet.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Lighten up, will you, Henry? What’s the matter? All of a sudden, money don’t make you happy!

Speaker: Henry
Text: After we pay back Bruno and you get your cut, then you could be happy.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, alright.
[In classical montage they sell drugs and have fun. Cheerful music is playing.]

Speaker: Whore
Text: You ain’t ever gonna give me a tip?

Speaker: Joe
Text: You want a tip? I’ll give you a tip. Don’t let the door hit you in the ass on the way out.

Speaker: Whore
Text: Always the gentlemen, huh Joey?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hahaha, just get the fuck out of here already.

Speaker: Girl from the Bar
Text: Hey, Gina! Wanna come join me?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey! I hope there’s room for three in there.
[After the time it takes for twenty-six-year-old Vito to bathe with two girls, he answers the phone.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Barbaro’s Bordello. You got the money, we got the honeys.

Speaker: Henry
Text: Vito, it’s Henry. We got a problem.

Speaker: Vito
Text: What kind of problem?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Eddie paid me a visit. Carlo knows about the deal, and he sent Eddie to pick up his cut.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Ugh. How much?

Speaker: Henry
Text: Sixty grand.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Fuck that much?! What’re we gonna do?

Speaker: Henry
Text: I don’t know, we don’t even have enough left for Bruno. Meet me in the park, I don’t want to talk about this over the phone.

Speaker: Vito
Text: OK, I’ll be right there. Joe. We gotta go.

Speaker: Joe
Text: What? What for?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Now, Joe. I’ll tell you on the way.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright. Girls, lock up when you leave. Me and Vito got business. So what the hell’s going on?

Speaker: Vito
Text: That was Henry on the phone. Carlo found out about the deal.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Ahhh shhhhhit! Does he know we was involved?

Speaker: Vito
Text: I don’t think so. Let’s talk about it in the car.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Where we headed?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Lincoln Park.

Speaker: Joe
Text: We meeting Henry there?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright, so what’d Henry say on the phone? He OK?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Sounded OK. But Carlo took his cut of the take.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fuck. Just like Henry said he’d do if he found out.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, but now the problem is we don’t even got enough to pay Bruno back.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Aah, shit! What the hell are we gonna do?

Speaker: Vito
Text: I don’t know. We’ll figure it out when we get to the park.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah. Henry’ll know what to do.
[They drive up to the park and get out of the car so they can walk to it.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Henry’s different these days, the guy’s got a real… What the fuck?

Speaker: Joe
Text: What the fuck’s going on!? Shit, that’s Henry! What the fuck are they hitting him with?!
[Henry’s lying on the asphalt by the park. A few Chinese people beat him with their feet and cut him with knives. Joe and Vito are killing them.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fuck! Who the fuck does something like this, Vito? Them people are fucking sick! Shit! Who the fuck does something like this?!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Who do you think?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Goddamnit, Henry. Look at this, Vito. You fucking believe this?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Money’s gone too.
[Henry is lying drenched in blood and bruises.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Joe, c’mon… We gotta get out of here. Cops’ll take care of Henry.
[There’s a car passing by with a Chinese man.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, hey! That’s the old guy who sold us the dope! Wong!
[They get in the car and chase Mr. Wong. A police car arrives at the crime scene.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Of all the ways to kill a guy… Goddamn bullet would’ve been enough.

Speaker: Joe
Text: These bastards are sick in the head, Vito. They’re gonna fucking die. All of ‘em.

Speaker: Vito
Text: I mean… Why do it like that… And in the middle of the park…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Like I said they’re sick. I’m gonna turn them into chop fucking suey.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, not for nothing - we don’t even know how many of them there are.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah, and it don’t matter.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hey, Henry’s dead. What do you want us to get killed too? We gotta do this smart, Joe.

Speaker: Joe
Text: It don’t matter how we do it. As long as they’re fucking dead when we’re done!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright listen, there’s probably more than two of them.

Speaker: Joe
Text: So what? The more, the fucking merrier!

Speaker: Vito
Text: So, there’s only two of us. And unless maybe you want to call Carlo and tell him all about the mess we’re in, ask him to send some guys over here…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Alright fine, I get it.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright, so promise me you’re not gonna go in guns blazing as usual. We gotta do this the smart way. Alright?
[They’re following Wong’s car to a Chinese restaurant.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Now we know where to find him.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Let’s get in there and take him out before he disappears with the money.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Hold on, we gonna need some serious firepower first.

Speaker: Joe
Text: We can either go to Harry’s or we can kill these fucks right now. Just say the word.
[Vito goes the restaurant called the Red Dragon. Inside it is furnished in a classic Chinese style.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Sorry, gentlemen this place for member only.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Here’s your fucking membership fee.
[He pulls out a gun and kills both guards with a shot to the head.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Goddamn it, Joel Can’t you listen to me for once?

Speaker: Joe
Text: No I can’t! You seen what they done to Henry.
[Naturally, there’s a bridge shootout with Chinese gangsters. Restaurant visitors are yelling, and everywhere you can hear the sound of beating dishes and spilling blood.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Goddammit, Joe. You see? Why didn’t you just bang the damn gong while you were at it?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Pipe down and help me waste these little fucks. Get the asshole behind the bar! Die, you piece of shit! Watch out, they’re shooting from up top! Take ‘em out quick, Vito. We gotta find Wong! C’mon, Vito, let’s move up. Get the guy on the stairs! Up there in the window! Come on! Who taught you assholes how to shoot!? Hey, leave some of these little bastards for me! Where the fuck are they all coming from?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Must be a tunnel to China around here somewhere…

Speaker: Joe
Text: You fucked with the wrong guys, didn’t you? Alright, you go first, Vito. You’re a smaller target.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Thanks… Fat ass…

Speaker: Joe
Text: Hey, you said we gotta do this smart, right? Come on, you little bastards! Where the hell is that prick?

Speaker: Vito
Text: He’s gotta be around here somewhere! Let’s keep going. Jeez, these fucks just keep on coming. How many more they got back there?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Don’t matter. I got plenty of bullets left. Haha… Bingo… This is for Henry, you bastards!
[They go into a room where they smoke opium. The bodies of drug addicts are all over the place.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Shh, be quiet, Vito.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Since when are you concerned about making noise?

Speaker: Joe
Text: There’s too many of ‘em, just take him out nice and quiet.
[Vito shoots the head of the first Chinese gangster. He cannot do it otherwise.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Are you deaf or what?! I said we should be quiet! Alright, that was the last of them. See? Ain’t so bad so far, right?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Yeah, but what if somebody recognizes us and Carlo hears about it?

Speaker: Joe
Text: That’s why we ain’t leaving no witnesses. There’s probably more of ‘em down here. Get ready.
[They’re breaking into Mr. Wong’s office.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: You’re dead, you slanty eyed fuck!

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: What is it that you want?
[Joe hits his head with a gun handle.]

Speaker: Joe
Text: What the fuck do you think we want?!

Speaker: Vito
Text: We want to know why you had our friend killed We also want the money you took from him.

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: I had no choice. Your friend was a government informer.

Speaker: Joe
Text: What the fuck are you talking about?!

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: Our contact inside the Federal Bureau of Narcotics told me that Henry Tomasino passed them information about our deal.

Speaker: Joe
Text: That’s a fucking lie!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa - you saying Henry was a rat?

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: Yes, but not anymore.

Speaker: Joe
Text: That’s bullshit! It makes no sense. And I suppose you had nothing to do with the little stick up after we closed the deal with you either, right?

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: You think we would take such a stupid risk? And destroy our own factory? That was just another reason to get rid of you. We had problems with you from the very beginning.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Oh yeah? Well, all your problems are just about over, pal. So where’s our money?

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: It’s not here anymore.

Speaker: Joe
Text: What?!

Speaker: Vito
Text: Where the hell is it then?

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: I cannot tell you.

Speaker: Joe
Text: If you don’t tell us, I’m gonna splatter your yellow brains all over this fucking room.

Speaker: Mr. Wong
Text: If I told you, I’d be dead anyway.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fine, your choice.
[He’s blowing his brains out.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Are you crazy?

Speaker: Joe
Text: What’d you want to do, let him go or something?!

Speaker: Vito
Text: We could’ve gotten more out of him!

Speaker: Joe
Text: Fuck that! He wouldn’t have said nothing. These bastards are tough.

Speaker: Vito
Text: Let’s just get the hell outta here before the cops come.
[They go out of the office and walk through the workshops where migrants from China worked. After our drug dealers visited them, they are released from work for life. ]

Speaker: Vito
Text: Looks like this place won’t be opening up for a while.

Speaker: Joe
Text: If we had the time I’d burn it to the damn ground. Vito, come here, this should be the way out…
[There are a few police cars waiting for them outside…]

Speaker: Joe
Text: Aw, fuck this! C’mon, Vito, let’s get out of here! There’s too many of them! Find us a car, quick! Alright… we lost ‘em. Take me to my place, Vito. I need a fucking drink…

Speaker: Vito
Text: That was uh … That was fucked up, huh?

Speaker: Joe
Text: Yeah. I don’t wanna talk about it. Just get me back to my place, would ya?

Speaker: Vito
Text: Alright.
[Joe’s apartment. Vito and Joe are standing outside smoking cigarettes.]

Speaker: Vito
Text: This deal was a total fucking disaster.

Speaker: Joe
Text: Tell me about it.
